Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a plain discus and a ring handle at the rear. Within the double base-ring is the name PHOETASPI|S in relief. Brown-buff clay, with mica covered with a red-brown slip. Nozzle and handle broken.. The nozzle and handle are broken.
Curator's comments: Wellcome Collection Nos. A 17903; 13636. See Sotheby's 'Sale Catalogue', 2 Sept. 1919, Lot 153.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1949)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
